column2: VERMONT DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: go faster.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 2. When driving in winter, you should NOT:
column4: use cruise control.
column6: check your vehicle's antifreeze level and windshield washer fluid.
column8: use snow tires on all four wheels of your vehicle.

column2: 3. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 4. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
column6: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.
column8: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.
column10: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: No turn on red
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not enter

column2: 6. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
column10: The traffic light will soon be red.

column2: 7. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: signal.

column2: 8. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column8: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column10: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.

column2: 9. To drive more safely at night:
column4: don’t drive when you are tired.
column6: increase following distance.
column8: make sure your headlights are working properly.

column2: 10. Before backing up, you should:
column4: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: flash your headlights.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 11. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 12. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look into the rearview mirror.
column10: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 13. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: green and white.
column6: black and orange.
column8: brown and white.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 15. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column10: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.

column2: 16. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: dangerous.
column6: a place where stopping is required.
column8: safe to cross.
column10: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.

column2: 17. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: sound the horn.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 18. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the crosswalk.
column6: On the crosswalk.
column8: After the crosswalk.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column6: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column8: Lane reduction ahead
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 20. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: increase your speed immediately.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
